hints.content:
We can think of division as the following:

$\greenD{\text{ Total}}\div\blueD{\text{ Number of Groups}}$

or 

$\greenD{\text{ Total}}\div\maroonD{\text{ Size of the Groups}}$

We have a $\greenD{\text{total}}$ of $\greenD{21}$ elephants.

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ of elephants is $\maroonD7$.  

Which image shows $\greenD{21}$ elephants divided evenly into groups of $\maroonD7$?

Here is  the correct image:


[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

[[☃ image 3]]

options.alt: A group of seven elephants has a rectangle around it. !
A group of seven elephants has a rectangle around it. !
A group of seven elephants has a rectangle around it. !

question.content:
At the zoo, there are $21$ elephants divided evenly into groups of $7$.

**Which image could represent this situation?**


[[☃ radio 1]]
